newsitem.title: USA: Wyser-Pratte, Spear push Huntsman on Rexene bid.
newsitem.headline: Wyser-Pratte, Spear push Huntsman on Rexene bid.

text.p: Two dissident shareholder groups in chemical company Rexene Corp have written a letter asking Huntsman Corp to make its position clear on whether it can finance the acquisition of Rexene.

Guy P. Wyser-Pratte, president of Wyser-Pratte & Co Inc, and Fred Kambeitz, a partner at Spear, Leeds & Kellogg, wrote to Jon Hunstman saying that while they believed Huntsman should acquire Rexene, Huntsman has not provided enough information to shareholders.

"For better or worse, investors have doubts about Huntsman's position on Rexene, despite its outstanding record of closing chemical industry acquisitions and your assurances that financing will not be a problem for Huntsman," the shareholders said.
Huntsman has said it made three offers for Rexene but would no longer deal with the present management.
Rexene recently announced a Dutch auction tender for 11.5 percent of its own shares at between $14.00 and $16.00 per share and has been fighting off the attentions of Wyser-Pratte and Spear.
The company is to hold a shareholder meeting on April 30 and the dissidents have been trying to oust the incumbent board.

Wyser-Pratte and Spear said that if still interested in acquiring Rexene, privately-held Huntsman should issue a statement that "there are no material financing or due diligence conditions to an acquisition by Huntsman."
The dissidents also said that Huntsman should meet with two recently-appointed Rexene board members, Richard Perry and Stephen Swid, to explain to them in detail plans for financing.
"As you can see, investors are in a state of confusion. Please help them by clarifying your intentions," they said in the letter.
No one from Huntsman was immediately available for comment. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
